snippet: Judging by the stock markets, investors aren’t too worried yet about the debate in Washington over impending tax increases and spending cuts.
abstract: Politicians remain locked in rancorous debate over impending tax increases and spending cuts and it remains unclear if deal will be reached by end of 2012, but investors are already betting lawmakers will do enough to avoid heading over so-called fiscal cliff; share prices have climbed steadily, rising to reach their highest point since late October.
lead_paragraph: Judging by the stock markets, investors aren’t too worried yet about the debate in Washington over impending tax increases and spending cuts.

headline.seo: Investors Stay Calm, if Cautious, as Stalemate Simmers
headline.main: Investors Stay Calm, if Cautious, as Stalemate Simmers
